hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Hasan Abu Muhammad: We came back with a man from the central mosque, and entered upon Abu Zaid al-Ansari. His leg had been wounded on the day of Uhud with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. When the prayer time came, he gave the call to prayer while sitting, and gave the iqama while sitting. Then he said to a man: Come forward and lead us in prayer.

narrators.name: Abdul-Malik ibn Amr
narrators.full_name: Abdul-Malik ibn Amr ibn Dinar Abu Amir al-Aqadi

chainIssues: Chain is maqtu' (stops at al-Hasan, not reaching a companion)
al-Hasan uses عَنِ which could indicate indirect transmission

potential_issues.issue: Chain is maqtu' - does not reach the Prophet ﷺ or a companion
potential_issues.impact: Maqtu' hadith is not directly applicable as evidence of what the Prophet ﷺ did or said, though it may be useful for understanding early Islamic practices

potential_issues.issue: al-Hasan al-Basri uses عَنِ (indirect transmission term)
potential_issues.impact: While al-Hasan is generally reliable, the indirect transmission term creates some ambiguity about direct witnessing

potential_issues.issue: Ali ibn al-Mubarak is a lesser-known narrator with limited transmission records
potential_issues.impact: This narrator is not prominently featured in major hadith collections, which affects overall chain strength

Topics: Call to prayer (Adhan) method by a wounded companion
Incident of Abu Zaid al-Ansari wounded at Uhud
Accommodation for injured companions in Islamic practice

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Zaid ibn Akhtab: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to me: May Allah beautify you. Anas (ibn Sirin) said: And he was indeed a beautiful man with handsome gray hair.

narrators.full_name: Qurrah ibn Khalid ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Fihri

potential_issues.impact: This is not problematic as Anas ibn Sirin is reliable and Anas definitely heard from Abu Zaid, and the text explicitly states 'حَدَّثَنِي' (narrated to me)

Topics: Compliments given by the Prophet ﷺ to companions
Gray hair and beauty of elderly companions

hadiths.english_translation: And Nu'ailah, brother of Ghifar, accompanied the Prophet ﷺ until the Prophet ﷺ passed away. Then he moved to Basra and settled there. Ziyad ibn Abi Sufyan appointed him as governor of Khurasan and he went out to it.

chainIssues: Biographical record, not a hadith transmission

potential_issues.issue: This is biographical information, not a hadith with chain of transmission
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be properly analyzed as a hadith

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-Hasan: Ziyad sent al-Hakam ibn Amr to Khurasan. Allah granted them conquest and they obtained great wealth. So Ziyad wrote to him: As for what follows: The Commander of the Believers wrote to me that I should set aside the gold and silver for him. So do not distribute gold or silver among the people. He wrote back: Peace be upon you. As for what follows: You wrote to me mentioning the letter of the Commander of the Believers. I found the Book of Allah before the letter of the Commander of the Believers. And by Allah, even if the heavens and earth were sealed upon a servant, if he feared Allah, Allah would make a way out for him.

chainIssues: Chain is maqtu' - stops at al-Hasan al-Basri
al-Hasan uses عَنِ which could indicate indirect transmission

potential_issues.issue: Chain is maqtu' and does not reach the Prophet ﷺ or a companion
potential_issues.impact: This is historical narrative, not a direct prophetic hadith

potential_issues.issue: al-Hasan al-Basri uses عَنِ (indirect transmission) and is known for tadlis
potential_issues.impact: There is uncertainty about the direct transmission of this report

Topics: Conquest of Khurasan by Muslim forces
Conflict between religious law and administrative orders
Incident of al-Hakam ibn Amr as governor
Principle of obeying Allah's law over governor's orders

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by the uncle of my father Rafi' ibn Amr al-Ghifari: I was a boy throwing dates from palm trees. Someone said to the Prophet ﷺ: There is a boy here throwing our dates. So I was brought to the Prophet ﷺ. He said: O boy, why are you throwing the dates? I said: To eat. He said: Do not throw the dates. Rather eat from what falls at the bottom of them. Then he wiped my head and said: O Allah, fill his belly.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Dharr: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Indeed there will be from my nation after me people who recite the Quran but it does not pass beyond their throats. They depart from the religion like an arrow departs from the bowstring. Then they do not return to it. They are the worst of creation and creatures. Sulayman said: I think he said: Their mark is shaving their beards. Abdullah ibn al-Samit said: I met Rafi' ibn Amr al-Ghifari, brother of al-Hakam ibn Amr.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Abdullah ibn al-Samit and Abu Dharr both use عَنْ
Sulayman ibn al-Mughirah adds a doubtful wording about beard-shaving

potential_issues.issue: The narrator Sulayman ibn al-Mughirah expresses doubt about the exact wording regarding the Kharijites' distinguishing mark
potential_issues.impact: This uncertainty about the specific wording affects the reliability of that portion of the hadith

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn al-Samit is classified as Saduq, not among the highest reliability ranks
potential_issues.impact: The chain contains multiple narrators of intermediate reliability (Saduq level) which may affect overall assessment

Topics: Description of those who memorize Quran without understanding
